RelatedSentence: Park Geun-hye , President of South Korea apologized formally on Monday for the ferry disaster last month which killed 300 passengers , mostly school children .
She also added that she would dismantle the coast guard as they had failed in their rescue mission .
She also added that she would dismantle the coast guard as they had failed in their rescue mission .
The ferry Sewol capsized and sank with 476 passengers and crew on board and at least 286 people were killed and 18 remain missing .
The ferry Sewol capsized and sank with 476 passengers and crew on board and at least 286 people were killed and 18 remain missing .
Besides holding the ferry owners , the captain and crew responsible , Park singled out problems within the coast guard as the main reason for the high casualty toll from the accident .
Had there been an immediate and proactive rescue operation after the accident , we would have been able to reduce the casualties , Park said .
